name: Leopard Tortoise
description: Adults have a highly domed carapace with muted brown shades, while juveniles display a striking dark brown pattern on a beige background.
image_alt: Leopard Tortoise, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Carapace length up to 70 cm, weight 30−50 kg
reproduction: The female lays 5−18 eggs, incubation lasts 100−180 days.
attractions: It often hides in termite mounds or abandoned jackal burrows, where females also lay eggs. It can climb surprisingly well and swims effectively.
breeding: We first bred offspring in 2005, with a second generation hatching in 2012.
